feedingNotes: Feed at NIGHT in darkness when frogs wake up - promotes natural hunting behavior
Sub-adults (7-11 months): 5-7 medium feeders every other day
Adults (1 year+): 3-5 large feeders every two to three days
Crickets and dubias are excellent staples - vary feeders for nutrition
Gut-load feeders and dust with calcium/D3 2-3x weekly
waterNotes: Use tap water treated with reptisafe OR spring water (NOT distilled/RO unless remineralized)
Shallow dish with easy exit - clean and disinfect regularly
mistingNotes: DO NOT use misters or foggers - they raise humidity too high and promote bacterial/respiratory infections
Semi-arid species thrives in DRY conditions (30-40% humidity)
Natural room humidity with proper ventilation is usually sufficient
If humidity drops below 30%, lightly mist one corner only and ensure ventilation

feedingNotes: Feed appropriate-sized prey items based on species requirements
Vary feeder insects for nutritional diversity
Dust with calcium and vitamin supplements as recommended
waterNotes: Provide clean, dechlorinated water at all times
Change water regularly to prevent bacterial growth
mistingNotes: Mist as needed to maintain proper humidity levels
Ensure adequate ventilation to prevent mold growth
